title: Some 300 vehicles stuck at harbour as Customs demand taxes triple vehicle value: Importers
byline: Some 300 brand new vehicles have been stranded at the Hambantota Port for more than six months, with individual importers complaining that Sri Lanka Customs is demanding taxes amounting to nearly three times the original value of the vehicles to secure their release.

title: Education reforms; Govt. gives in to pressure
byline: In a move signalling a setback for the NPP government, the Cabinet has decided to postpone the Grade 6 education reforms following concerns raised by religious leaders, the Opposition and the public.

title: Rainfall expected to decrease from tomorrow: Met. Department
byline: The Department of Meteorology announced that a reduction in rainfall across the island can be expected from tomorrow (15).

title: Committee recommends careful use of balance X-Press Pearl funds
byline: The Sectoral Oversight Committee on Environment, Agriculture and Resource Sustainability has recommended that any remaining compensation funds related to the damage caused by the X-Press Pearl vessel be utilized exclusively for purposes directly linked to the environmental and economic impact of the disaster.

title: Exclusive Rolls-Royce tells Dudley’s success story
byline: The recent acquisition of a rare Rolls-Royce Phantom Centenary Edition by Sri Lankan businessman Dudley Sirisena has drawn attention not only for the vehicle’s exclusivity, but also for the long entrepreneurial journey behind it.

title: Mark Ruffalo calls Trump ‘the worst human being in the world’ at Golden Globes
byline: Mark Ruffalo had strong words for Donald Trump on the red carpet of Golden Globes on Sunday night. The actor was asked about his pin, which read “Be Good,” and explained that he was wearing it to honor Renee Nicole Good, who was shot and killed by an ICE agent last week.

title: COPF questions allocation of large sum of funds for salaries of Samurdhi Authority employees
byline: Committee on Public Finance (COPF) has called for new criteria to select eligible recipients of Aswesuma social security scheme while inquiring on over allocation of funds for the payment of salaries to the employees of the Department of Samurdhi Development which implement the scheme.

title: Prosecutors seek death penalty for ex-South Korean president Yoon
byline: Prosecutors have asked for South Korea’s former president Yoon Suk Yeol to be handed a death sentence if he is found guilty over his botched attempt to impose martial law.

title: Another foreign company pulls out as investor confidence takes a hit
byline: In what appeared to be a fresh blow to the country’s investor confidence, China-based Amber Adventures (Private) Limited – the country’s first cable car venture - has officially pulled out of the Ambuluwawa Cable Car Project, citing what it called ‘ regulatory obstruction and arbitrary state action’.

title: Parliament to take up resolution to appoint select committee to probe Ditwah unpreparedness
byline: Parliament is scheduled to take up a resolution next week to appoint a select committee to probe the lack of preparedness for Cyclone Ditwah, according to the Office of the Leader of the House.

title: Opposition secures majority in CMC standing committees
byline: The Opposition secured a majority of members in most standing committees of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) today, including the key Finance Standing Committee, which oversees the council’s financial affairs.

title: Murder, attempted murder charges filed against bus driver in Kala Oya bridge tragedy
byline: Charges of murder and attempted murder have been filed against a private bus driver accused of causing the deaths of two passengers and endangering the lives of 66 others, including a High Court Judge, after he attempted to drive a bus across the submerged Kala Oya bridge during severe flooding.

title: GMOA warns of island-wide continuous trade union action
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has warned that it will launch continuous island-wide trade union action if the Health Minister fails to implement agreements reached to resolve key issues affecting the free health service and doctors.

title: Sri Lankan man admits murdering Sri Lankan woman in UK
byline: A Sri Lankan man pleaded guilty to the murder of a Sri Lankan woman who was found on a street in Cardiff.

title: The UK is expected to approve a ’mega’ Chinese embassy in London despite objections
byline: Britain’s government is expected to approve a “mega” Chinese embassy close to London’s financial district after years of controversy and political wrangling over the potential security risks it poses to the U.K.

title: Prices of imported milk powder to be reduced from January 16
byline: Importers have agreed to reduce the prices of imported milk powder from January 16, the Ministry of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development said today.

title: Investor momentum returned as the market closed higher
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange closed on a positive note on 14 January 2026, as renewed investor interest lifted market momentum during the session. The All Share Price Index advanced by 100.9 points, or 0.43 percent, to close at 23,708.70, after gaining more than 165 points at mid-session. Activity in the market picked up notably, with 73 crossings across 22 counters, signalling a return of confidence among investors.

title: No electricity tariff revision for first quarter of 2026: PUCSL
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced that electricity tariffs will remain unchanged for the first quarter of 2026, following the failure of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to submit a formal tariff revision proposal on time.

title: Brazil donates water purification units to support Sri Lanka’s flood relief efforts
byline: The Government of the Federative Republic of Brazil has donated 10 high-capacity Water Purification Units to assist Sri Lanka’s flood relief and recovery efforts following Cyclone Ditwah, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: 2026 school activities to continue under revised plan: Ministry
byline: The Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education Ministry has announced that school education activities for 2026 will proceed under revised arrangements, following decisions made at the Cabinet meeting on January 13, 2026.

title: Government to prioritize establishment of salaries and pensions commission, Says Minister
byline: The proposed Salaries and Pensions Commission will be established as a top priority to ensure sustainable management of public employee salaries and pensions, The Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister, Professor Chandana Abayaratne said.

title: President’s fund begins financial assistance to disaster-affected schoolchildren
byline: The President’s Fund has begun disbursing a Rs. 10,000 financial assistance grant to schoolchildren affected by the Ditwah cyclone, the Government Information Department said.

title: Arrest warrant on Wimal Weerawansa recalled after court appearance
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered the recall of the arrest warrant issued on former Minister Wimal Weerawansa after he surrendered to court through his counsel.

title: SLTB launches special bus services for Thai Pongal and long weekend
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has launched special bus services to accommodate travelers heading to their hometowns for the upcoming long weekend and Thai Pongal celebrations.

title: China announces record $1tn trade surplus despite Trump tariffs
byline: China announced record export numbers for 2025, a year when US President Donald Trump’s tariffs and trade policy caused turmoil in the global economy.

title: Remanded for allegedly soliciting bribe to enrol child in school
byline: A suspect produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court was today remanded until January 20 in connection with an alleged attempt to solicit a bribe to facilitate the admission of a child to Visaka Vidyalaya, Colombo.

title: Drug addiction in Kandy district rises fivefold in 2025: Senior DIG
byline: Drug addiction in the Kandy district has increased fivefold in 2025 compared to the previous year, Senior Deputy Inspector General of Police in charge of the Central Province, Lalith Pathinayake, said yesterday.

title: School train stranded for two months after track damage between Gampola and Ulapane
byline: A passenger train operating between Ulapane and Gampola railway stations has remained stranded for nearly two months following severe weather conditions caused by Cyclone Ditwah, our camera recorded on the 13th.

title: 2025 was the world’s third-warmest year on record, EU scientists say
byline: The planet experienced its third-warmest year on record in 2025, and average temperatures have exceeded 1.5 degrees Celsius of global warming over three years, the longest period since records began, EU scientists said on Wednesday.

title: Delaying implementation of education reforms will not resolve any crisis
byline: Delaying the implementation of education reforms will not resolve any matters, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Pakistan-origin USA cricketers await visa clearance for T20 World Cup
byline: Four US cricketers of Pakistan origin - Ali Khan, Shayan Jahangir, Mohammad Mohsin and Ehsan Adil are awaiting visa clearance to travel to India for the upcoming T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka after attending their scheduled appointment on Tuesday and submitting their documents at the Indian High Commission in Colombo.

title: Over 7,000 drunk driving cases filed in past year, Police warn drivers
byline: Over 7,000 cases of drunk driving were recorded in the past year, Deputy Inspector General of Police (DIG) W. P. J. Senadheera, who heads the Traffic Control and Road Safety Directorate, revealed yesterday.

title: National Hospital faces patient complaints over food, hygiene
byline: Patients at the Colombo National Hospital (CNH) have raised serious concerns over deteriorating services, claiming that basic facilities including cleaning and meal provision are not being carried out according to established procedures.

title: Another bomb scare reported at Badulla District Labour Office
byline: Another bomb scare was reported at the Badulla District Labour Office today following two recent bomb threats targeting the Kandy District Secretariat, police said.

title: Retired Navy medical assistant arrested over Rs. 200,000 bribe
byline: A retired Navy medical assistant has been arrested on charges of demanding and accepting a bribe of Rs. 200,000, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) said.

title: Court issues arrest warrant on Wimal Weerawansa
byline: Colombo High Court Judge Mohamed Mihal today issued a warrant for the arrest of former Minister Wimal Weerawansa, who has been named as a defendant in a case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, over allegations of unlawfully acquiring assets worth over Rs. 75 million, due to his failure to appear before court.

title: At least 22 people killed after crane falls on train in northeast Thailand
byline: At least 22 people have been killed after a construction crane fell on a passenger train in northeast Thailand.

title: Direct Beijing–Colombo flights launched to boost connectivity
byline: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Beijing, in collaboration with Beijing Capital Airlines, has organized a destination promotion event to announce the launch of direct flights between Beijing and Colombo, marking a significant step in strengthening air connectivity between the two capitals.

title: Sri Lanka accused of persistent impunity for conflict-related sexual violence in UN-backed report
byline: Sri Lanka continues to fail survivors of conflict-related sexual violence, with decades of alleged abuses by State security forces remaining largely uninvestigated and unpunished, according to a new report covering the period from 1985 to 2024.
